snippet: Regulators agreed to require brokerage firms to separate their swaps customers’ accounts from company money. But the rule would not have prevented MF Global’s loss of customer money.
abstract: Regulators agreed to require brokerage firms to separate their swaps customers’ accounts from company money. But the rule would not have prevented MF Global’s loss of customer money.

headline.main: New Rules on Swaps Will Protect Big Traders
headline.print_headline: New Rules On Swaps Will Protect Big Traders
